title.en: Biographies of Laozi and Han Fei
title.raw: 《老子韓非列傳》 Biographies of Laozi and Han Fei

sentences.zh: 老子者，楚苦縣厲鄉曲仁里人也，姓李氏，名耳，字耼，周守藏室之史也。

translations.text: Laozi was a man of Qu Ren Village, Li Township, Ku County, Chu, surname Li, name Er, courtesy name Dan, Zhou's keeper of the archives.
Laozi was a man of Qu Ren Village, Li Township, Ku County, Chu, surname Li, name Er, courtesy name Dan, Zhou's keeper of the archives.

sentences.zh: 孔子適周，將問禮於老子。

translations.text: Confucius went to Zhou, about to ask about rites from Laozi.

sentences.zh: 老子曰：「子所言者，其人與骨皆已朽矣，獨其言在耳。

translations.text: Laozi said: 'What you speak of, their persons and bones have all rotted away, only their words remain.

sentences.zh: 且君子得其時則駕，不得其時則蓬累而行。

translations.text: Moreover gentlemen getting their time then drive, not getting their time then roll along like tumbleweed.

sentences.zh: 吾聞之，良賈深藏若虛，君子盛德容貌若愚。

translations.text: I have heard that good merchants deeply hide as if empty, gentlemen of great virtue appear foolish in countenance.

sentences.zh: 去子之驕氣與多欲，態色與淫志，是皆無益於子之身。

translations.text: Rid yourself of arrogant airs and many desires, affected expressions and licentious ambitions, these are all of no benefit to your person.

sentences.zh: 吾所以告子，若是而已。」

translations.text: What I tell you is only this.'

sentences.zh: 孔子去，謂弟子曰：「鳥，吾知其能飛；

translations.text: Confucius left, told his disciples: 'Birds, I know they can fly;

sentences.zh: 魚，吾知其能游；

translations.text: fish, I know they can swim;

sentences.zh: 獸，吾知其能走。

translations.text: beasts, I know they can run.

sentences.zh: 走者可以為罔，游者可以為綸，飛者可以為矰。

translations.text: Runners can be netted, swimmers can be lined, flyers can be arrowed.

sentences.zh: 至於龍，吾不能知其乘風雲而上天。

translations.text: As for dragons, I cannot know how they ride wind and clouds up to heaven.

sentences.zh: 吾今日見老子，其猶龍邪！」

translations.text: I today saw Laozi, it was like a dragon!'

Confucius went to Zhou, about to ask about rites from Laozi. Laozi said: 'What you speak of, their persons and bones have all rotted away, only their words remain. Moreover gentlemen getting their time then drive, not getting their time then roll along like tumbleweed. I have heard that good merchants deeply hide as if empty, gentlemen of great virtue appear foolish in countenance. Rid yourself of arrogant airs and many desires, affected expressions and licentious ambitions, these are all of no benefit to your person. What I tell you is only this.' Confucius left, told his disciples: 'Birds, I know they can fly; fish, I know they can swim; beasts, I know they can run. Runners can be netted, swimmers can be lined, flyers can be arrowed. As for dragons, I cannot know how they ride wind and clouds up to heaven. I today saw Laozi, it was like a dragon!'

sentences.zh: 老子修道德，其學以自隱無名為務。

translations.text: Laozi cultivated morality and virtue, his learning took self-concealment and namelessness as its purpose.

sentences.zh: 居周久之，見周之衰，乃遂去。

translations.text: Stayed in Zhou for a long time, seeing Zhou's decline, then departed.

sentences.zh: 至關，關令尹喜曰：「子將隱矣，彊為我著書。」

translations.text: Arrived at the pass, the pass commander Yin Xi said: 'You will hide yourself, force yourself to write a book for me.'

sentences.zh: 於是老子乃著書上下篇，言道德之意五千餘言而去，莫知其所終。

translations.text: Thus Laozi wrote a book in upper and lower chapters, speaking of the meaning of morality and virtue in over five thousand words and departed, none know where he ended.

Laozi cultivated morality and virtue, his learning took self-concealment and namelessness as its purpose. Stayed in Zhou for a long time, seeing Zhou's decline, then departed. Arrived at the pass, the pass commander Yin Xi said: 'You will hide yourself, force yourself to write a book for me.' Thus Laozi wrote a book in upper and lower chapters, speaking of the meaning of morality and virtue in over five thousand words and departed, none know where he ended.

sentences.zh: 或曰：老萊子亦楚人也，著書十五篇，言道家之用，與孔子同時云。

translations.text: Some say: Lao Lai Zi was also a Chu man, wrote fifteen chapters, speaking of Daoist applications, contemporary with Confucius.
Some say: Lao Lai Zi was also a Chu man, wrote fifteen chapters, speaking of Daoist applications, contemporary with Confucius.

sentences.zh: 蓋老子百有六十餘歲，或言二百餘歲，以其修道而養壽也。

translations.text: Laozi was over one hundred sixty years old, some say over two hundred years, because he cultivated the Dao and nurtured longevity.
Laozi was over one hundred sixty years old, some say over two hundred years, because he cultivated the Dao and nurtured longevity.

sentences.zh: 自孔子死之後百二十九年，而史記周太史儋見秦獻公曰：「始秦與周合，合五百歲而離，離七十歲而霸王者出焉。」

translations.text: After Confucius died 129 years, and the records say Zhou Grand Historian Tan saw Qin Lord Xian saying: 'Originally Qin and Zhou united, united five hundred years and separated, separated seventy years and a hegemon-king will emerge.'

sentences.zh: 或曰儋即老子，或曰非也，世莫知其然否。

translations.text: Some say Tan was Laozi, some say not, the world does not know if it was so or not.

sentences.zh: 老子，隱君子也。

translations.text: Laozi was a concealed gentleman.

After Confucius died 129 years, and the records say Zhou Grand Historian Tan saw Qin Lord Xian saying: 'Originally Qin and Zhou united, united five hundred years and separated, separated seventy years and a hegemon-king will emerge.' Some say Tan was Laozi, some say not, the world does not know if it was so or not. Laozi was a concealed gentleman.

sentences.zh: 老子之子名宗，宗為魏將，封於段干。

translations.text: Laozi's son named Zong, Zong was Wei general, enfeoffed at Duan Gan.

sentences.zh: 宗子注，注子宮，宮玄孫假，假仕於漢孝文帝。

translations.text: Zong's son Zhu, Zhu's son Gong, Gong's great-grandson Jia, Jia served Han Xiaowen Emperor.

sentences.zh: 而假之子解為膠西王卬太傅，因家于齊焉。

translations.text: Jia's son Xie was Jiaoxi King Ang's tutor, thus established household in Qi.

Laozi's son named Zong, Zong was Wei general, enfeoffed at Duan Gan. Zong's son Zhu, Zhu's son Gong, Gong's great-grandson Jia, Jia served Han Xiaowen Emperor. Jia's son Xie was Jiaoxi King Ang's tutor, thus established household in Qi.

sentences.zh: 世之學老子者則絀儒學，儒學亦絀老子。

translations.text: Those in the world who study Laozi then belittle Confucian learning, Confucian learning also belittles Laozi.

sentences.zh: 「道不同不相為謀」，豈謂是邪？

translations.text: 'Ways different do not plan for each other', is this what is meant?

sentences.zh: 李耳無為自化，清靜自正。

translations.text: Li Er non-action self-transforms, pure quiet self-corrects.

Those in the world who study Laozi then belittle Confucian learning, Confucian learning also belittles Laozi. 'Ways different do not plan for each other', is this what is meant? Li Er non-action self-transforms, pure quiet self-corrects.

sentences.zh: 莊子者，蒙人也，名周。

translations.text: Zhuangzi was a Meng man, named Zhou.

sentences.zh: 周嘗為蒙漆園吏，與梁惠王、齊宣王同時。

translations.text: Zhou once was Meng lacquer garden official, contemporary with Liang Hui King and Qi Xuan King.

sentences.zh: 其學無所不闚，然其要本歸於老子之言。

translations.text: His learning overlooked nothing, yet its essentials fundamentally returned to Laozi's words.

sentences.zh: 故其著書十餘萬言，大抵率寓言也。

translations.text: Thus his written books over one hundred thousand words, for the most part allegorical tales.

sentences.zh: 作漁父、盜跖、胠篋，以詆訿孔子之徒，以明老子之術。

translations.text: Made Fisherman, Robber Zhi, Cutting Open Boxes, to mock and ridicule Confucius's followers, to clarify Laozi's techniques.

sentences.zh: 畏累虛、亢桑子之屬，皆空語無事實。

translations.text: Fearful Burden Void, Kang Sang Zi and the like, all empty words without actual events.

sentences.zh: 然善屬書離辭，指事類情，用剽剝儒、墨，雖當世宿學不能自解免也。

translations.text: Yet good at connecting books and separating phrases, pointing to affairs and analogizing feelings, using to strip Confucians and Mohists, even contemporary veteran scholars could not exempt themselves.

sentences.zh: 其言洸洋自恣以適己，故自王公大人不能器之。

translations.text: His words vast and unrestrained to suit himself, therefore even kings and great men could not value him.

sentences.zh: 楚威王聞莊周賢，使使厚幣迎之，許以為相。

translations.text: Chu Wei King heard Zhuang Zhou was worthy, sent envoys with rich gifts to welcome him, promised to make him prime minister.

sentences.zh: 莊周笑謂楚使者曰：「千金，重利；

translations.text: Zhuang Zhou laughing told Chu envoy: 'Thousand gold, heavy profit;

sentences.zh: 卿相，尊位也。

translations.text: prime minister, honored position.

sentences.zh: 子獨不見郊祭之犧牛乎？

translations.text: You alone have not seen the suburban sacrifice's sacrificial ox?

sentences.zh: 養食之數歲，衣以文繡，以入大廟。

translations.text: Raised and fed several years, clothed in embroidered patterns, to enter the great temple.

sentences.zh: 當是之時，雖欲為孤豚，豈可得乎？

translations.text: At that time, though wishing to be a lone piglet, how could it be obtained?

sentences.zh: 子亟去，無污我。

translations.text: You quickly go, do not defile me.

sentences.zh: 我寧游戲污瀆之中自快，無為有國者所羈，終身不仕，以快吾志焉。」

translations.text: I would rather frolic in mud and filth to please myself, not be restrained by rulers of states, lifelong not serve, to delight my ambitions.'

Chu Wei King heard Zhuang Zhou was worthy, sent envoys with rich gifts to welcome him, promised to make him prime minister. Zhuang Zhou laughing told Chu envoy: 'Thousand gold, heavy profit; prime minister, honored position. You alone have not seen the suburban sacrifice's sacrificial ox? sentences.zh: 申不害者，京人也，故鄭之賤臣。

translations.text: Shen Buhai was a Jing man, formerly Zheng's humble minister.

sentences.zh: 學術以干韓昭侯，昭侯用為相。

translations.text: Used learning and technique to petition Han Zhao Hou, Zhao Hou employed him as prime minister.

sentences.zh: 內修政教，外應諸侯，十五年。

translations.text: Within repaired governance and teaching, without responded to feudal lords, fifteen years.

sentences.zh: 終申子之身，國治兵彊，無侵韓者。

translations.text: Throughout Shen Zi's lifetime, state orderly troops strong, none invaded Han.

sentences.zh: 申子之學本於黃老而主刑名。

translations.text: Shen Zi's learning based on Huang Lao yet emphasized punishment and name.

sentences.zh: 著書二篇，號曰申子。

translations.text: Wrote books in two chapters, called Shen Zi.

sentences.zh: 韓非者，韓之諸公子也。

translations.text: Han Fei was one of Han's various princes.

sentences.zh: 喜刑名法術之學，而其歸本於黃老。

translations.text: Delighted in punishment-name law-technique learning, yet his foundation returned to Huang Lao.

sentences.zh: 非為人口吃，不能道說，而善著書。

translations.text: Fei had a stutter, could not speak fluently, yet was good at writing books.

sentences.zh: 與李斯俱事荀卿，斯自以為不如非。

translations.text: Together with Li Si served Xun Qing, Si considered himself inferior to Fei.

Han Fei was one of Han's various princes. Delighted in punishment-name law-technique learning, yet his foundation returned to Huang Lao. Fei had a stutter, could not speak fluently, yet was good at writing books. Together with Li Si served Xun Qing, Si considered himself inferior to Fei.

sentences.zh: 非見韓之削弱，數以書諫韓王，韓王不能用。

translations.text: Fei saw Han's weakening and reduction, repeatedly with writings remonstrated Han King, Han King could not use him.

sentences.zh: 於是韓非疾治國不務修明其法制，執勢以御其臣下，富國彊兵而以求人任賢，反舉浮淫之蠹而加之於功實之上。

translations.text: Thus Han Fei resented governing the state not striving to clarify its legal system, grasp power to control ministers below, enrich state strengthen troops yet seek others to appoint the worthy, instead raise floating licentious parasites and place them above actual merit.

sentences.zh: 以為儒者用文亂法，而俠者以武犯禁。

translations.text: Considered Confucians use writing to disorder law, while knights use martial force to violate prohibitions.

sentences.zh: 寬則寵名譽之人，急則用介胄之士。

translations.text: Relaxed then favor men of reputation, urgent then use armored warriors.

sentences.zh: 今者所養非所用，所用非所養。

translations.text: Now what is nurtured is not what is used, what is used is not what is nurtured.

sentences.zh: 悲廉直不容於邪枉之臣，觀往者得失之變，故作孤憤、五蠹、內外儲、說林、說難十餘萬言。

translations.text: Pitied uprightness not tolerated by crooked ministers, observed past gains and losses changes, thus wrote Lonely Indignation, Five Parasites, Inner and Outer Stores, Forest of Sayings, Difficulty of Persuasion over one hundred thousand words.

translations.text: Yet Han Fei knew persuasion's difficulty, his Difficulty of Persuasion book very complete, ultimately died in Qin, could not save himself.

translations.text: Difficulty of Persuasion says:

sentences.zh: 凡說之難，非吾知之有以說之難也；

translations.text: The difficulty of all persuasion is not that my knowledge has difficulty in what to persuade;

sentences.zh: 又非吾辯之難能明吾意之難也；

translations.text: also not that my eloquence has difficulty in clarifying my intent;

sentences.zh: 又非吾敢橫失能盡之難也。

translations.text: also not that my courage has difficulty in thoroughly exhausting it.

sentences.zh: 凡說之難，在知所說之心，可以吾說當之。

translations.text: The difficulty of all persuasion lies in knowing the persuaded one's heart, so my persuasion can match it.

sentences.zh: 所說出於為名高者也，而說之以厚利，則見下節而遇卑賤，必棄遠矣。

translations.text: The persuaded emerges from seeking high name, yet persuade with thick profit, then seen as lowly conduct encountering humble position, certainly abandoned and distanced.

sentences.zh: 所說出於厚利者也。

translations.text: The persuaded emerges from thick profit.

sentences.zh: 而說之以名高，則見無心而遠事情，必不收矣。

translations.text: Yet persuade with high name, then seen as without heart and far from affairs, certainly not accepted.

sentences.zh: 所說實為厚利而顯為名高者也，而說之以名高，則陽收其身而實疏之；

sentences.zh: 夫事以密成，語以泄敗。

translations.text: Affairs succeed through secrecy, words fail through leakage.

sentences.zh: 未必其身泄之也，而語及其所匿之事，如是者身危。

translations.text: Not necessarily his own person leaks it, yet words touch on affairs he conceals, like this the person is in danger.

sentences.zh: 貴人有過端，而說者明言善議以推其惡者，則身危。

translations.text: Noble has fault beginnings, yet persuader clearly speaks good plans to push his evils, then person in danger.

sentences.zh: 周澤未渥也而語極知，說行而有功則德亡，說不行而有敗則見疑，如是者身危。

translations.text: Favor not yet abundant yet speaks extreme knowledge, persuasion succeeds and has merit then virtue lost, persuasion does not succeed and has defeat then seen as suspicious, like this person in danger.

sentences.zh: 夫貴人得計而欲自以為功，說者與知焉，則身危。

translations.text: Noble obtains plan and wishes to consider it his own merit, persuader shares knowledge of it, then person in danger.

sentences.zh: 彼顯有所出事，迺自以為也故，說者與知焉，則身危。

translations.text: He superficially has emerged affairs, actually considers them his own doing, persuader shares knowledge of it, then person in danger.

sentences.zh: 彊之以其所必不為，止之以其所不能已者，身危。

translations.text: Force him with what he certainly will not do, stop him with what he cannot help but do, person in danger.

sentences.zh: 故曰：與之論大人，則以為閒己；

translations.text: discuss petty men with him, then considers you selling influence.

sentences.zh: 論其所愛，則以為借資；

sentences.zh: 論其所憎，則以為嘗己。

translations.text: discuss what he hates, then considers you testing him.

sentences.zh: 徑省其辭，則不知而屈之；

sentences.zh: 凡說之務，在知飾所說之所敬，而滅其所醜。

translations.text: The essentials of all persuasion lie in knowing to adorn what the persuaded respects, and extinguish what he finds ugly.

sentences.zh: 彼自知其計，則毋以其失窮之；

translations.text: He himself knows his plans, then do not press him with his losses;

sentences.zh: 自勇其斷，則毋以其敵怒之；

translations.text: He himself braves his decisions, then do not anger him with his enemies;

sentences.zh: 自多其力，則毋以其難概之。

translations.text: he himself boasts his strength, then do not overwhelm him with its difficulty.

sentences.zh: 規異事與同計，譽異人與同行者，則以飾之無傷也。

translations.text: Plan different affairs with same plan, praise different people with same travelers, then adorn them without harm.

sentences.zh: 有與同失者，則明飾其無失也。

translations.text: Have those with same losses, then clearly adorn their no loss.

sentences.zh: 大忠無所拂悟，辭言無所擊排，迺後申其辯知焉。

translations.text: Great loyalty has no opposing awakening, flowery words have no attacking repelling, only then extend his eloquence and wisdom.

sentences.zh: 此所以親近不疑，知盡之難也。

translations.text: This is why close and intimate without suspicion, thoroughly knowing the difficulty.

sentences.zh: 得曠日彌久，而周澤既渥，深計而不疑，交爭而不罪，迺明計利害以致其功，直指是非以飾其身，以此相持，此說之成也。

translations.text: Obtain broad days increasingly long, and favor already abundant, deep plans without suspicion, contending without crime, only then clarify plan advantages and disadvantages to achieve its merit, directly point right and wrong to adorn his person, with this mutually holding, this is persuasion's success.

The essentials of all persuasion lie in knowing to adorn what the persuaded respects, and extinguish what he finds ugly. He himself knows his plans, then do not press him with his losses; He himself braves his decisions, then do not anger him with his enemies; he himself boasts his strength, then do not overwhelm him with its difficulty. Plan different affairs with same plan, praise different people with same travelers, then adorn them without harm. Have those with same losses, then clearly adorn their no loss. Great loyalty has no opposing awakening, flowery words have no attacking repelling, only then extend his eloquence and wisdom. This is why close and intimate without suspicion, thoroughly knowing the difficulty. Obtain broad days increasingly long, and favor already abundant, deep plans without suspicion, contending without crime, only then clarify plan advantages and disadvantages to achieve its merit, directly point right and wrong to adorn his person, with this mutually holding, this is persuasion's success.

sentences.zh: 伊尹為庖，百里奚為虜，皆所由干其上也。

translations.text: Yi Yin became cook, Bai Li Xi became captive, all the paths by which they petitioned their superiors.

sentences.zh: 故此二子者，皆聖人也，猶不能無役身而涉世如此其汙也，則非能仕之所設也。

translations.text: Therefore these two sons, all sages, yet could not avoid debasing their persons and entering the world in such filth, then this is not what able service establishes.

Yi Yin became cook, Bai Li Xi became captive, all the paths by which they petitioned their superiors. Therefore these two sons, all sages, yet could not avoid debasing their persons and entering the world in such filth, then this is not what able service establishes.

sentences.zh: 宋有富人，天雨牆壞。

translations.text: Song had a rich man, heaven rained wall collapsed.

sentences.zh: 其子曰「不築且有盜」，其鄰人之父亦云，暮而果大亡其財，其家甚知其子而疑鄰人之父。

translations.text: His son said 'not repair and moreover have thieves', his neighbor's father also said so, evening and indeed greatly lost their wealth, his family greatly trusted his son yet suspected the neighbor's father.

sentences.zh: 昔者鄭武公欲伐胡，迺以其子妻之。

translations.text: In ancient times Zheng Wu Gong wished to attack Hu, thus married his son to them.

sentences.zh: 因問群臣曰： 「吾欲用兵，誰可伐者？」

translations.text: Then asked the ministers: 'I wish to use troops, who can be attacked?'

sentences.zh: 關其思曰：「胡可伐。」

translations.text: Guan Qi Si said: 'Hu can be attacked.'

sentences.zh: 迺戮關其思，曰：「胡，兄弟之國也，子言伐之，何也？」

translations.text: Thus executed Guan Qi Si, said: 'Hu is brother state, you speak of attacking it, why?'

sentences.zh: 胡君聞之，以鄭為親己而不備鄭。

translations.text: Hu lord heard it, considered Zheng close to himself and did not prepare against Zheng.

sentences.zh: 鄭人襲胡，取之。

translations.text: Zheng people attacked Hu, took it.

sentences.zh: 此二說者，其知皆當矣，然而甚者為戮，薄者見疑。

translations.text: These two persuaders, their knowledge all appropriate, yet the severe one executed, the light one suspected.

sentences.zh: 非知之難也，處知則難矣。

translations.text: Not that knowledge is difficult, but applying knowledge is difficult.

Song had a rich man, heaven rained wall collapsed. His son said 'not repair and moreover have thieves', his neighbor's father also said so, evening and indeed greatly lost their wealth, his family greatly trusted his son yet suspected the neighbor's father. In ancient times Zheng Wu Gong wished to attack Hu, thus married his son to them. Then asked the ministers: 'I wish to use troops, who can be attacked?' Guan Qi Si said: 'Hu can be attacked.' Thus executed Guan Qi Si, said: 'Hu is brother state, you speak of attacking it, why?' Hu lord heard it, considered Zheng close to himself and did not prepare against Zheng. Zheng people attacked Hu, took it. These two persuaders, their knowledge all appropriate, yet the severe one executed, the light one suspected. Not that knowledge is difficult, but applying knowledge is difficult.

sentences.zh: 昔者彌子瑕見愛於衛君。

translations.text: In ancient times Mi Zi Xia was loved by Wei lord.

sentences.zh: 衛國之法，竊駕君車者罪至刖。

translations.text: Wei state's law, stealing the lord's carriage drivers punished by amputation.

sentences.zh: 既而彌子之母病，人聞，往夜告之，彌子矯駕君車而出。

translations.text: Soon Mi Zi's mother ill, people heard, went at night to inform him, Mi Zi falsely took the lord's carriage and went out.

sentences.zh: 君聞之而賢之曰：「孝哉，為母之故而犯刖罪！」

translations.text: Lord heard and considered him worthy saying: 'Filial indeed, for mother's sake violates amputation punishment!'

sentences.zh: 與君游果園，彌子食桃而甘，不盡而奉君。

translations.text: With lord touring orchard, Mi Zi ate peach and sweet, not finished and presented to lord.

sentences.zh: 君曰：「愛我哉，忘其口而念我！」

translations.text: Lord said: 'Loves me indeed, forgets his mouth and thinks of me!'

sentences.zh: 及彌子色衰而愛弛，得罪於君。

translations.text: When Mi Zi appearance declined and love slackened, offended the lord.

sentences.zh: 君曰：「是嘗矯駕吾車，又嘗食我以其餘桃。」

translations.text: Lord said: 'This once falsely took my carriage, also once fed me with his remaining peach.'

sentences.zh: 故彌子之行未變於初也，前見賢而後獲罪者，愛憎之至變也。

translations.text: Therefore Mi Zi's conduct not changed from beginning, previously seen as worthy yet later obtained crime, love and hate's extreme change.

sentences.zh: 故有愛於主，則知當而加親；

translations.text: Therefore have favor with lord, then knowledge appropriate and add closeness;

sentences.zh: 見憎於主，則罪當而加疏。

translations.text: seen as hated by lord, then crime appropriate and add distance.

sentences.zh: 故諫說之士不可不察愛憎之主而後說之矣。

translations.text: Therefore remonstrating persuaders cannot not examine the lord's loves and hates then persuade him.

sentences.zh: 夫龍之為蟲也，可擾狎而騎也。

translations.text: The dragon as an insect, can be disturbed and familiarly ridden.

sentences.zh: 然其喉下有逆鱗徑尺，人有嬰之，則必殺人。

translations.text: Yet its throat below has reverse scales one foot across, if a person touches them, then certainly kills the person.

sentences.zh: 人主亦有逆鱗，說之者能無嬰人主之逆鱗，則幾矣。

translations.text: The ruler also has reverse scales, persuaders who can avoid touching the ruler's reverse scales, then nearly succeed.

In ancient times Mi Zi Xia was loved by Wei lord. Wei state's law, stealing the lord's carriage drivers punished by amputation. Soon Mi Zi's mother ill, people heard, went at night to inform him, Mi Zi falsely took the lord's carriage and went out. Lord heard and considered him worthy saying: 'Filial indeed, for mother's sake violates amputation punishment!' With lord touring orchard, Mi Zi ate peach and sweet, not finished and presented to lord. Lord said: 'Loves me indeed, forgets his mouth and thinks of me!' When Mi Zi appearance declined and love slackened, offended the lord. Lord said: 'This once falsely took my carriage, also once fed me with his remaining peach.' Therefore Mi Zi's conduct not changed from beginning, previously seen as worthy yet later obtained crime, love and hate's extreme change. Therefore have favor with lord, then knowledge appropriate and add closeness; seen as hated by lord, then crime appropriate and add distance. Therefore remonstrating persuaders cannot not examine the lord's loves and hates then persuade him. The dragon as an insect, can be disturbed and familiarly ridden. Yet its throat below has reverse scales one foot across, if a person touches them, then certainly kills the person. The ruler also has reverse scales, persuaders who can avoid touching the ruler's reverse scales, then nearly succeed.

sentences.zh: 人或傳其書至秦。

translations.text: Someone transmitted his book to Qin.

sentences.zh: 秦王見孤憤、五蠹之書，曰：「嗟乎，寡人得見此人與之游，死不恨矣！」

translations.text: Qin king saw Lonely Indignation, Five Parasites book, said: 'Alas, I could see this person and travel with him, die without regret!'

sentences.zh: 李斯曰：「此韓非之所著書也。」

translations.text: Li Si said: 'This is Han Fei's written book.'

sentences.zh: 秦因急攻韓。

translations.text: Qin thus urgently attacked Han.

sentences.zh: 韓王始不用非，及急，乃遣非使秦。

translations.text: Han king initially did not use Fei, when urgent, then sent Fei as envoy to Qin.

sentences.zh: 秦王悅之，未信用。

translations.text: Qin king pleased with him, not yet employed.

sentences.zh: 李斯、姚賈害之，毀之曰：「韓非，韓之諸公子也。

translations.text: Li Si, Yao Jia harmed him, slandered saying: 'Han Fei is Han's various princes.

sentences.zh: 今王欲并諸侯，非終為韓不為秦，此人之情也。

translations.text: Now king wishes to annex the feudal lords, Fei ultimately for Han not for Qin, this is human feeling.

sentences.zh: 今王不用，久留而歸之，此自遺患也，不如以過法誅之。」

translations.text: Now king does not employ, long detain and return him, this leaves disaster for oneself, not as good as executing by false law.'

sentences.zh: 秦王以為然，下吏治非。

translations.text: Qin king considered it so, sent officials to treat Fei.

sentences.zh: 李斯使人遺非藥，使自殺。

translations.text: Li Si sent men to give Fei medicine, made him commit suicide.

sentences.zh: 韓非欲自陳，不得見。

translations.text: Han Fei wished to explain himself, could not be seen.

sentences.zh: 秦王後悔之，使人赦之，非已死矣。

translations.text: Qin king later regretted it, sent men to pardon him, Fei already dead.

sentences.zh: 申子、韓子皆著書，傳於後世，學者多有。

translations.text: Shen Zi, Han Zi both wrote books, transmitted to later generations, scholars have many.

sentences.zh: 余獨悲韓子為說難而不能自脫耳。

translations.text: I alone pity Han Zi wrote Difficulty of Persuasion yet could not save himself.

Someone transmitted his book to Qin. Qin king saw Lonely Indignation, Five Parasites book, said: 'Alas, I could see this person and travel with him, die without regret!' Li Si said: 'This is Han Fei's written book.' Qin thus urgently attacked Han. Han king initially did not use Fei, when urgent, then sent Fei as envoy to Qin. Qin king pleased with him, not yet employed. Li Si, Yao Jia harmed him, slandered saying: 'Han Fei is Han's various princes. Now king wishes to annex the feudal lords, Fei ultimately for Han not for Qin, this is human feeling. Now king does not employ, long detain and return him, this leaves disaster for oneself, not as good as executing by false law.' Qin king considered it so, sent officials to treat Fei. Li Si sent men to give Fei medicine, made him commit suicide. Han Fei wished to explain himself, could not be seen. Qin king later regretted it, sent men to pardon him, Fei already dead. Shen Zi, Han Zi both wrote books, transmitted to later generations, scholars have many. I alone pity Han Zi wrote Difficulty of Persuasion yet could not save himself.

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：老子所貴道，虛無，因應變化於無為，故著書辭稱微妙難識。

translations.text: The Grand Historian says: Laozi valued the Dao, emptiness nothingness, responding to changes at non-action, therefore his book words speak of subtle mystery difficult to recognize.

sentences.zh: 莊子散道德，放論，要亦歸之自然。

translations.text: Zhuangzi scattered morality and virtue, unrestrained discussions, in essentials also return to naturalness.

sentences.zh: 申子卑卑，施之於名實。

translations.text: Shen Zi lowly and humble, applied to name and reality.

sentences.zh: 韓子引繩墨，切事情，明是非，其極慘礉少恩。

translations.text: Han Zi drew ink lines, cut affairs, clarified right and wrong, his extreme harsh cruel lacking mercy.

sentences.zh: 皆原於道德之意，而老子深遠矣。

translations.text: All originated from morality and virtue's intent, yet Laozi profound and far-reaching.

The Grand Historian says: Laozi valued the Dao, emptiness nothingness, responding to changes at non-action, therefore his book words speak of subtle mystery difficult to recognize. Zhuangzi scattered morality and virtue, unrestrained discussions, in essentials also return to naturalness. Shen Zi lowly and humble, applied to name and reality. Han Zi drew ink lines, cut affairs, clarified right and wrong, his extreme harsh cruel lacking mercy. All originated from morality and virtue's intent, yet Laozi profound and far-reaching.
